method_missing  

Constants

GENERATED_CODE_DIR = "#{RAILS_ROOT}/generated_models"   automatic code generation for debugging you will get a folder "generated_models" in RAILS_ROOT containing valid Ruby files explaining all ActiveRecord relationships set up by the plugin, as well as listing the line in the plugin that made each particular macro call

External Aliases

method_missing -> original_method_missing

Public Instance methods

method_missing(method_name, *args, &block)

[Source]

    # File /home/yossarian/aptana_workspace/imcalendar/config/../vendor/plugins/has_many_polymorphs/lib/has_many_polymorphs/debugging_tools.rb, line 26
26:       def method_missing(method_name, *args, &block)
27:         if COLLECTION_METHODS.include? method_name.to_sym
28:           Dir.chdir GENERATED_CODE_DIR do
29:             filename = "#{demodulate(self.name.underscore)}.rb"
30:             contents = File.open(filename).read rescue "\nclass #{self.name}\n\nend\n"
31:             line = caller[1][/\:(\d+)\:/, 1]
32:             contents[-5..-5] = "\n  #{method_name} #{args[0..-2].inspect[1..-2]},\n     #{args[-1].inspect[1..-2].gsub(" :", "\n     :").gsub("=>", " => ")}\n#{ block ? "     #{block.inspect.sub(/\@.*\//, '@')}\n" : ""}     # called from line #{line}\n\n"
33:             File.open(filename, "w") do |file| 
34:               file.puts contents             
35:             end
36:           end
37:           # doesn't handle blocks cause we can't introspect on code like that in Ruby without hackery and dependencies
38:           self.send("original_#{method_name}", *args, &block)
39:         else
40:           self.send(:original_method_missing, method_name, *args, &block)
41:         end
42:       end

[Validate]
